name: Magna Grecia Boutique Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Magna Grecia in Athens on our first night in Greece. The room was small, but had everything we needed - including an inward facing room not on the main road. The roof top terrace is quite lovely with good views of the acropolis, though the restaurant there is quite pricey. Magna Grecia is a short walk from two main metro stations, which is a real selling point of this place, as well as the location in a lovely part of historic Athens. The service here is also great - we left early in the morning before the buffet breakfast opened and the hotel staff packed us a very filling breakfast. Would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Great hotel, wonderful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really liked this hotel, mostly because of the location. We arrived at the Syntagma Metro station from the airport and walked 5-10 minutes to the hotel. It was little hard to find since the only thing on the street level is a door---next to a carpet shop! The reception is on the 2nd floor.
reviews.title: Great location!!

reviews.text: We had an inside room, no windows to the outside, but that was okay with us. The room was lovely and more than adequate. The location is the best thing about this hotel. It is in walking distance to everything there is to see in Athens, and walk we did, so should you. It is the best was to experience this city.
reviews.title: Beautiful location, high ceilings but lack of luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast is served on the top floor (4th?) with a wonderful views of the Acropolis.
reviews.title: Worst experience in our trip to Greece.

reviews.text: They even checked us out the evening prior to leaving so that we could catch the first train to the airport----very early flight.
reviews.title: Stay at another hotel, it's just not worth the money

reviews.text: Excellent beds and clean rooms. Some rooms have small showers and only double beds. Small elevator and many steps. Acropolis view is across from a church with bells every 1/2 hr. Good Wifi. Average breakfast. No kleenex in the baths. Very helpful front desk personnel.
reviews.title: Bells, Bells, Bells

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We experienced the worst night ever in this hotel. Due to the beautiful fotos in the internet we booked online and arrived in the late afternoon. Still we had to wait due to repair issues. As we finally got into the room we were shocked!! There were no windows, the room was tiny, the bathroom old and worn and - worst of all - this jailhouse was stinking intensively of old smoke. We immediately asked for another room, but due to the receptionist there was no other available. They offered us to give us the money back - and we could go ahead an look for another hotel. As we only had one evening in town we did not think this as an option for us - BIG MISTAKE! I did not sleep a second due to the smoked filled air, the stinking blankets and cusions. And as noted: there was no possibility to open a window to let fresh air into the room. A stinking jail house room!!!
reviews.title: stinking jail house room

reviews.text: We found fine hospitality at the Magna Grecia four nights in September. The location was perfect. Opening our window onto the Mitropoli plaza or sitting on the rooftop terrace we listened to the sounds of life on the plaza below and watched the changing light on the Acropolis above. The rooms were clean and quiet, particularly the back room. On the front side, the heavy windows closed off the noise of the street. Breakfast was great, thanks to the sweet hostess in charge, and we enjoyed picnic suppers several evenings enjoying the lights on the Parthenon after dark. We began our Greek holiday here, and came back for a night in the middle and at the end. We were heartily welcomed back each time and enjoyed the quiet ambience as the perfect place to reflect on our travels. Hope to come back someday......
reviews.title: The rooftop terrace provided inspirational view and a place for relaxation and reflection.

reviews.text: top notch location across from historic plaka district with stunning views of the acropolis...worth paying extra for the view...beautiful historic decor in guest rooms, hallways, and breakfast area...very generous breakfast...even fresh-squeezed orange juice...terrace has one of the best views in the city...extremely helpful staff...even made up an extra breakfast for me to-go as I had to leave at 4:00 a.m. to catch an early morning flight...I have stayed several places in Athens over the years but this was by far the best
reviews.title: a special opportunity not to be missed

reviews.text: The negative reviews here are correct.
reviews.title: No sleep at night - Δεν μπορείς να κοιμηθείς το βράδυ

reviews.text: Our room was number 104 with high ceilings and a great acropolis view. The room was clean and fresh and bathroom was nicely sized with great water pressure in the shower. Location could not have been better within easy walking distance of most sights. Breakfast was good, a good continental style with the best part being the fresh orange juice squeezed a glass at a time after you choose and cut your own orange. The only negative would be the service at the front desk, which was often absent. The staff often did not address you when entering or exiting, and this we didnt bother to ask for anything. Dinner on the rooftop should be done just for the view, the food was average and on the expensive side.
reviews.title: Amazing view and a cute romantic room

reviews.text: This isa clean hotel, very close to all tourist attractions and with a a wonderful view. room , but along with the view came the noise.The hotel is situated on a very busy street across from a busy square. The cathedral bells ring regularly. The rooms are small and the bathroom is tiny! There are no tea and coffee making facilities or water in the fridge. Never the less we were comfortable and all this was worth it for the amazing Acroplis views.
reviews.title: Wonderful view, but.........

reviews.text: I had very high hopes when booking this hotel 7 months before our arrival. I was looking for something a bit different to chain hotels as part of my girlfriend's 30th birthday surprise trip to Greece. The website does show immaculate and charming looking rooms, and maybe some of them are! Not the one we stayed in unfortunately.
reviews.title: Do not believe that this a 'boutique' hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a massive anti-climax and I was slightly embarrassed because I booked this secretly. The acropolis view room we had was very small and was full of cheap or old furniture with no thought to decoration like I had been lead to believe. The bed was sagging with old covers on top. It immediately reminded me of a $25 hotel room in Thailand, and I felt cheated that I paid €175 a night for it.
reviews.title: Great concept for a traveller who likes a bit of funky quirkiness

reviews.text: Other rooms may be in better shape and I'm sure people have had good experiences at Magna Grecia, but if this is the case, there is a major inconsistency throughout the hotel.
reviews.title: great location...but didn't get much sleep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some folks love this place and some hate it. We stayed here for three nights in October and can understand both points of view. This is an older hotel that reminds me of places I stayed in 35 years ago. The "inside" rooms have views of the elevator shaft and hallway. They can be dark and dreary. The elevator is tiny; barely big enough for 2 people and the air conditioning can be iffy. But the help is very pleasant, the breakfast is good, the location is excellent, and...the view of the acropolis is simply unbelievable. So, the outside rooms are well worth the price, and the view is available to all on the breakfast patio. All the guidebooks will tell you where to go for the best views and note that you will have to pay an exorbitant price for your coffee or drinks in order to get it. The view here is better than all those and it is free.
reviews.title: This hotel elicits strong opinions on both sides

reviews.text: We reserved 2 "Acropolis View" Rooms for four nights over the internet for my wife and I , 22 year old daughter and 19 year old son specifically requesting twin beds in each room, which they noted in our reservation confirmation as a "special request." When we arrived we were told that those rooms only come with one double bed (which would have been ok for my wife and I but not our son and daughter) and gave our son and daugher an interior windowless room with two beds at the same price. We never would have booked the rooms had we known this. To add insult to injury they told as that if we left they would charge us for a full night plus 50% for each of the remaining three nights of our reservation, even though their internet site provides for a cancellation fee of only one night. To top it off, the accomodations were nothing like their internet site indicated. The lift was inadequate (a small 2 person lift for the entire hotel) , the beds were saggy and uncomfortable, the rooms and furniture were worn and the breakfast was mediocre at best. The plumbing was in poor shape (eg you cannot flush toilet paper down the toilet) . There was a foot high door sill at the entry to our room. My wife had injured herself prior to arrival and was only able to walk with difficulty so this combined with the inadequate elevator and steps at the entrance made it particularly bad . After one night we checked out anyway, and they still insisted on charging us for 50% of the next three nights .
reviews.title: They mislead us, overcharged us and the accomodations were awful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately i had only stayed in this hotel for 2 nights, but must admit it was perfect. Beautifully decored clean rooms, friendly and smiley staff and fantastic views. There was variety at breakfast in which i might add was overlooking the Acropolis. The hotel is situated close to all attractions and shopping strips. Reception pointed me and my partner in the right direction when it came time to choose a restaurant for dinner and a nice little bar for late night drinks. two thumbs up at reception staff!!! This hotel is a definate for anyone who wants to be in the centre of EVERYTHING!!!
reviews.title: SENSATIONAL VIEWS FROM BEDROOM

description: Offering amazing views of the Acropolis, this intimate 4 star boutique hotel is centrally situated in historic Plaka, possibly the most charming Athens neighborhood, 5 minutes' walk from Syntagma Square.
